intro: Sarcanthus poilanei, commonly known as the Madagascar star lily, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes orchids, and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped flowers. The plant features showy, brightly colored blooms that are typically pink or white, with a distinctively intricate pattern. Sarcanthus poilanei is a terrestrial herb that thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species.
